comments:
Build: 20020214

Description:
NullPointerException occurs when attempting to close the project properties 
dialog (right click, Properties) with OK when the following holds:

    * Project was checked out of CVS but has no CVS nature
    * The CVS element in the properties tree of the project properties 
      dialog was selected (no attempt at modifying any fields was made)

The problem does not occur when the CVS element was not selected.

Stacktrace:

This page is contributed by VCM - moving

I don't understand how you can get in this state.  You should get a CVS nature 
if you've checked it out from CVS.

Regardless, our properties contribution are keyed by nature, so the CVS entry 
won't show up if there is no CVS nature.

Marking invalid in the absence of any more info.
Pls reopen if further details available.

This *only* happens in the packages view - our properties are not being 
filtered by project nature.

For example, if in the packages view you create a brand new Java Project, go to 
its properties, you will see a CVS entry.  The same doesn't happen in the 
Navigator.  The user should not get a CVS properties entry for non CVS 
projects.  Just to be sure I looked at our contribution code and we are 
filtering by nature with adaptable=true.

Moving to UI to determine if its theirs or JDT-UI's.


I don't understand how the reporter was able to load a project from CVS and NOT 
get a CVS nature, but that's a different matter.  If the reporter can elaborate 
and file a seperate bug on this, after checking against the M4 build, that 
would be appreciated.

The project was checked out of CVS using the external CVS command and then 
added as a project to the workspace (it had no .project/.vcm_meta).

However, I can't reproduce this problem on 20020321, so it can be marked 
resolved.
Marked as resolved at posters request
